‚Ä¢ Track & review moving history
‚Ä¢ 4G & LTE CAT1 network connection
‚Ä¢ Monitor movement speed, maximum speed
‚Ä¢ Turn on & off the Defense remotely to help protect and prevent theft
‚Ä¢ Turn off Defense with PIN code when the car is offline
‚Ä¢ Automatically prevent forgetting to turn off the Smartkey lock knob to help protect the battery and prevent theft
‚Ä¢ Multiple warnings: engine on/off, vibration, geographic area in/out, moving,…
‚Ä¢ IP65 Waterproof, dustproof
‚Ä¢ Smart battery power saving
‚Ä¢ Overvoltage protection, voltage pulse suppression, reverse polarity

Power cord signal port integrated relay #    Port Signal Color Detail Description     Port A (4P) ACC Orange Connect to the vehicle’s electric lock signal wire, positive pole    Relay Yellow Connect to an external RELAY to turn on/off the vehicle’s power supply    VDC_IN Red Connect to positive voltage 12/24 VDC    GND Black Connect to Mass    ‚ùó Note: The ACC and RELAY wire colors here apply to read and determine on the power cord bundle, which is the accessory number 2 in section 2.2.2. Not applicable at the tail wire of the device body.
5. Standard power cord signal port #    Port Signal Color Detail Description     Port A (4P) ACC_IN White Is the signal wire behind the lock (with power when the vehicle key is turned on) connected to the pin of the Jack connector connected to the top of the padlock wire (next to the padlock).    ACC_OUT Green Is the output power cord for the vehicle to operate and connects to the pin of the other end of the Jack connector connected to the bottom of the padlock wire.    VDC_IN Red Connect to positive voltage 12/24 VDC    GND Black Connect to Mass    ‚ùó Note: The signal port of the integrated Relay power cord is identified as accessory number 2 in section 2.1

contents:
Welcome to the GoTrack GPS platform # SMC GLOBAL TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT AND APPLICATIONS JOINT STOCK COMPANY ( GoTrack) is a company specializing in providing solutions and equipment to monitor vehicles/goods and people for individuals and businesses, bringing great value in management and monitoring, helping to save time and money. , human resources with the era of technology application 4.0.
So, GoTrack created GPS software for vehicle surveillance with many outstanding features. You can completely track where the car is, in case of an emergency, you can completely grasp the vehicle situation under your control.
GoTrack’s GPS navigation software interface:
The software interface is diverse: Interface on a Computer platform, interface on the mobile platform.
GPS navigation software GoTrack has many functions that make it difficult for users to refuse:
 It is possible to track multiple people on a single map. Online monitoring: Real-time position, direction, status, speed of the vehicle. Store and Review travel routes: During the last month or option. Manage accounts and settings: Manage users, passwords, sub-accounts, monitoring zone settings, maximum speed, driving, fuel consumption norms, monitoring points … Protect your privacy and make sure only you can get your location data. Alerts and notifications about PC and phone. Reporting system: general report, detailed report, route report, engine time report, camera image report, fuel consumption report, … And much other expansion features according to customer requirements.  Below is the home page interface (Overview) of the software.
  Area 1: Vertical menu is used for quick access to frequently used tools and settings.  Click once on  to expand the vertical menu. (Click once more on  to collapse the vertical menu).      Area 2 : Search for devices/accounts. See details here    Area 3 : Account information.    Area 4 : General data display area.  Statistics according to the chart: Devices that are about to and have expired. Devices by state. Type of device. Deploy equipment,…    Advanced search # Search for devices #   Step 1: Click on  Search on Menu : User can enter both the name or some characters contained in IMEI / Device name / License plate / Generated SIM number.    Step 2: Select the Device tab. After displaying results that are not as desired, you can search again in the following 2 criteria:  IMEI / Device name / License plate : User can enter both the name or some characters contained in the generated IMEI / Device Name / Number Plate. SIM number : Enter your phone number.      Step 3: Click Search.    Step 4: After showing the correct result. You can click on:   Information: Switch to screen [Device Repair]  Monitoring: Switch to a new tab to the page [Map] to the location of that device.  : Switch to screen Equipment management.    Search for an account #   Step 1: Click on  / Enter Search on menu.    Step 2: Select tab Account:  Account / Username: Enter both the account name/registered user or a few characters present in the account / user name. Email: Users can enter both the registered Email name or a few characters contained in their Email.      Step 3: Click Search. If Reset is pressed, it will return to factory defaults.    Step 4: After displaying the correct results to find. You can click on:   Information: Switch to screen [Edit account.]  Monitoring: Switch to a new tab to the page [Map] to the location of that device.  : Switch to screen [Account Management] / [Equipment management] / [Reset Password] depending on selection.

Alias Account # 1. Role alias #   Sub-accounts are created from the main account and linked to the main account.
  Sub-accounts have many different functions and can vary considerably depending on where they are and what their goals are.
  To grant permission for a sub-account to perform any function, do the following:
 Go to  Manage >  Alias >  Role alias. If there are many child accounts, click on the account tree, select the account you want to create additional roles for.  1.1 Search #    Name: Enter 1 or more characters to display the fastest results.
  Press Search to display the results.
  1.2. Add #   Step 1 : Click on  Create Role alias.    Step 2 : Enter information:  Name : Enter the name of the role you want to grant permissions to. Description : Give permission for this sub-account to do,… Choose permission : Enable/disable the permissions you want the sub-account to do.
Scroll down to enable/disable other permissions.      Step 3 : Click Add to complete the operation.  1.3. Edit #  To edit a secondary role, perform the following steps:
 Step 1 : Click on  Edit of the created sub-role name. Step 2 : Edit information (if any) Step 3 : Click Save Changes to save the edited information.  1.4. Delete #  To remove a Secondary Role, do the following:
 Click on  of the created Sub-Role name. A dialog box appears:  OK : If you agree to delete. Cancel : If you don’t want to delete.    2. User Alias #   Sub-accounts are created from the main account and linked to the main account.
  Sub-accounts have many different functions and can vary considerably depending on where they are and what their goals are.

contents:
Requirements #  Git ‚Äî latest source release Node.js ‚Äî latest LTS version or newer   Why Node.js? Doks uses npm (included with Node.js) to centralize dependency management, making it easy to update resources, build tooling, plugins, and build scripts. Start a new Doks project # Create a new site, change directories, install dependencies, and start development server.
Create a new site # Doks is available as a child theme and a starter theme.
Child theme #  Intended for novice to intermediate users Intended for minor customizations Easily update npm packages ‚Äî including Doks  git clone https://github.com/h-enk/doks-child-theme.git my-doks-site  Starter theme #  Intended for intermediate to advanced users Intended for major customizations Easily update npm packages  git clone https://github.com/h-enk/doks.git my-doks-site   Help me choose Not sure which one is for you? Pick the child theme. Change directories # cd my-doks-site  Install dependencies # npm install  Start development server # npm run start  Doks will start the Hugo development webserver accessible by default at http://localhost:1313. Saved changes will live reload in the browser.
Other commands # Doks comes with commands for common tasks. Commands ‚Üí
description: One page summary of how to start a new Doks project.
title: Quick Start

contents:
üí°  You can change the commands in the scripts section of `./package.json`.   create # Create new content for your site:
npm run create [path] [flags]  See also the Hugo docs: hugo new.
Docs based tree # Create a docs based tree ‚Äî with a single command:
npm run create -- --kind docs [section]  For example, create a docs based tree named guides:
npm run create -- --kind docs guides  lint # Check scripts, styles, and markdown for errors:
npm run lint  scripts # Check scripts for errors:
npm run lint:scripts [-- --fix]  styles # Check styles for errors:
npm run lint:styles [-- --fix]  markdown # Check markdown for errors:
npm run lint:markdown [-- --fix]  clean # Delete temporary directories:
npm run clean  start # Start local development server:
npm run start  build # Build production website:
npm run build  functions # Build Lambda functions:
npm run build:functions  preview # Build production website including draft and future content:
npm run build:preview
description: Doks comes with commands for common tasks.

Edit Device # To start Edit and configure the device, the user selects  Manage >  Devices
 Click on  Edit of that device, the following dialog box will appear:
 1. Basic #   Device information:
  IMEI: Device identification number. (No editing allowed).

  Icon: Click on the box right below to select the icon of the vehicle/vehicle in which you install the device.
  SIM number: Enter the phone number you are using.
  Activate: Account activation on/off status.
  Device name: The device name can be changed to make it easy to remember and easy to see.
  Device type: Select the device type name that corresponds to the device you are using.
  Device group: A group of devices that have something in common in an account.
   Step 1: Click on  to add a device group.
  Step 2: Select the account you want to add the device group to. Enter the device group name.
  Step 3: Click Add to complete the operation.
In addition, it is possible to create more device groups by as shown below:
 See more details here
  SIM type: Select the SIM type that corresponds to the carrier of the phone number.
      Services
 Service package : Device service pack in use (Not allowed to edit). Time to : Term of service pack (Not allowed to edit).      Warranty  Time from: Warranty activation date. Time to: Warranty expiration date.      Notes  Odometer (km) : When the car runs at the end of the day, it will automatically calculate the total distance that the car has traveled from before to yesterday.  If corrected to a different number, it will add from that number the number of kilometers traveled since that time of correction.   Notes : Type a note if you want to annotate something.      SIM  Check CCID : If on and the device changes SIM, the system will automatically lock the account (can only be turned on/off when the account has permission). CCID Origin : The first CCID SIM number assigned to the device. CCID : Current CCID SIM number. SIM number : Sim number of the device (can hide or show SIM number). Updated date : The update date changes the device’s SIM.      Sell info  SOLD : When the device has been sold to a stock account, it will automatically turn on. If not, it will be in off mode. Sell date : Set the device sale date to another account (if applicable). Updated time : The system automatically updates the device sale date when there is a change.    2. Advanced #  Vehicle information #   License plate : Variable number of vehicles on which the navigation device is installed. The number plate must be entered in the correct format: Instant writing, including both letters and numbers, it will be displayed on the Directorate for Roads.
  VIN number : The chassis number consists of 17 characters. (For cars).
  Distance factor : Is the distance in kilometers in 1 vector unit. By default, the distance factor is 1.0.
  Frame number : The vehicle identification number. A series of serial numbers and letters are chiseled into the chassis. (For motorcycles).
  Engine number : Your vehicle’s engine number. (For motorcycles).
  Driver: The name of the driver of the vehicle/vehicle installed with the navigation device. If you don’t have it, click 
  Account : The account name you want to add a driver to. Name : Name of the driver installing the device. Phone number : Driver’s phone number. License number : Driving license class. Begin date : Driver’s license date. Expired date : Expiration date of driving license. Code : Driver’s license code. Email : Driver’s email. Address : Driver’s address. Description : Describe more necessary information,…    Click Add to save the driver.
In addition, the driver can be added by as shown below:
 See more details here
 Fuel  Consumption rate (Litre/100km) : Set the vehicle’s fuel consumption limit for how many liters per 100km.      Advanced Features  Toll station : Can be turned on/off. When turned on when the vehicle passes through the toll booth, it will warn and correspond to the type of transport, it will calculate how much the vehicle will cost when passing. Type of transport : Choose 1 of 5 types of transport. (Applicable in Vietnam only)      Ministry of Transportation  Send data: Tick ‚Äã‚Äãon to send the device’s traffic data to the Directorate of Roads. Province: Select a province to send data. (Selected only when sending mode is enabled). Transport type QCVN: Choose one of the types of transport that is correct for the vehicle/vehicle in which you install the equipment. (Selectable only when sending mode is enabled).    3. Sensor # ‚ùó  Only accounts using Car service plan and above can have this item      Before adding a new sensor, see the diagram below, how the parameters are sent from the gps device and how they need to be paired with the sensors.    Click on  Add sensor , the following dialog box will appear:   Basic #   Step 1 : Click on Basic  Sensor name : ƒê·∫∑t bi·∫øn c·∫£m t√™n cho d·ªÖ nh·ªõ, d·ªÖ nh√¨n. Calculation method: Choose 1 of 3 methods: Calibration, Linear, Original. Input: Select the corresponding parameter. Sensor type : Select the sensor type corresponding to the unit of measurement. Unit: Select the unit to measure.      Step 2 : Click add to finish the operation.  Advanced #   Step 1 : Click on Advanced  Increase minimum : Enter the sensor value that changes with abnormal increase. Decrease minimum : Enter the sensor value that changes when an abnormal decrease occurs. Offset : Enter “zero” when calculating the ADC to output the correct temperature (sensor type). Round : How much do you round the sensor value after the sign (,). Sort: Arrange the sensor value to change to any position. Camera # ‚ùó  Only accounts with devices using Combo service plan or higher will have this item     Create camera #    Step 1 : Click on  Create camera
  Step 2 : Create Camera

Position : For vehicles that transmit data to the Ministry of Transport, it is mandatory to install cameras at the following 3 locations:

MDVR Id : ID printed on SM400 device. Host : IP address or domain name to access the camera server. Port : Connector to the camera recorder. Default is 6605. Channel ID : If the camera cable is plugged into the port of any channel, select that channel.

Extension #   Config  Timeout GPRS (minute) : The period of time after which the device does not update data after this period, the system considers the device as Lost. Stop duration (second) : Is the amount of time that if the vehicle stops beyond this interval, it will be counted as 1 stop. Engine input : Configure signal selection as Engine signal (Engine). Radius stop (0-1000m) : Is the distance that when the vehicle stops, if the newly updated coordinates are beyond this distance, the system will update. Min speed filter (km/h) : Is the speed value that when the device sends a speed lower than this value, the vehicle will be stopped. Invalid SIM is a field whose CCID is not equal to CCID Origin + CCID check must be enabled + CCID must be provided by GoTrack and exist in the SIM management system.  Sync CCID #   Sync CCID

IMEI new : Enter the new IMEI that is already in stock.   Step 4 : Click Save Changes to change IMEI.    Change service #   When the customer’s car wants to change to a new service pack, do the following:
  Step 1 : Select device need to switch service plan. Step 2 : Click on More >  >  Change service. Step 3 : A dialog box appears. Fill in the information in the form.   Account : Click on  to select the source account or enter the username/account.

‚ùó Note : The source account must have points greater than or equal to the total points needed to redeem the service pack.    Install signal #   When you want to quickly set up an alert, do the following:

contents:
Corridor # To view corridor information do the following:
 Step 1: Click on  to see a list of corridor.    Step 2: See the Corridor list. Can be  to hide/show one or more corridors on the map.   1. Create new # To create a new corridor, do the following:
   Step 1 : Click on Create New.
  Step 2 : Add corridor screen appears:
 Name : Short, easy to understand corridor name with the line you want to draw. Radius : Radius of corridor. Speed limit (km/h) : The maximum allowed speed at which the vehicle can travel when passing through that section of road. Position number : The automatic display when you draw the warning line on the Map. Color / Fill color : You can choose another color according to your preference. Opacity / Fill opacity : Can be adjusted up or down depending on your viewing angle. Description : Enter the specific address of that stretch of road. Or describe in detail information from the entrance-exit of the road where it passes,… Status : Enable/disable the existing corridor.    Step 3 : Click on the icon segment on the Map to add, edit, delete points forming the path. Zoom in/out, move to the line where the speeding warning should be drawn.
 Dot the points according to the route you want to create an alert. Click the endpoint again when you want to stop drawing a line segment. Click and hold the left mouse button on the white dot to drag and move to the right path. Clicking on the light gray point will automatically spawn 1 more point. With a straight path, just dot at the two ends of the road. Draw using as few points as possible while staying on the right path.    Step 4 : Click Add to create a corridor.
  2. Search # Can search by 1 of the following criteria:
  Step 1:  Name : Enter 1/ a few words in the created name to search. Click on icon  filter to filter by : Speed ‚Äã‚Äãlimit. Enter the speed to filter.      Step 2:  Click on  / press Enter to search. Or click on the icon  to refresh data, show the latest corridor.    3. View # CLick on icon  >  View of that corridor, will show the path drawn on the Map.
4. Edit #  To edit the corridor, follow these steps:  Step 1 : CLick on icon  >  Edit that corridor. Step 2 : Edit information (if any) such as speed, route,… Step 3 : Click Save Changes to save the edited information.     5. Delete #  To delete the corridor, follow these steps:  Step 1 : CLick on icon  >  Delete that corridor. Step 2 : If :  Select OK : Will delete that corridor. Select Cancel : Will cancel the operation.
title: 4.7 Corridor

Toll fee # To have the data displayed in Toll Station Report , users do the following in the following order:
1. Open advanced feature # First, the user must activate the Toll station card and select Type of transport, do the following:
   Step 1 : Click on  Map >  Info on the device list box.
  Step 2 : A dialog box as shown above appears. Select the Advanced tab.
    Step 3 : In line Advanced Features :  Enable Toll Station card. Choose the type of transport corresponds to the vehicle assigned to the locator.  Category 1: Vehicles with less than 12 seats, trucks with a tonnage of less than 2 tons and public passenger buses. Type 2: Vehicles from 12 seats to 30 seats, trucks with payload from 2 tons to under 4 tons. Category 3: Vehicles with 31 seats or more, trucks with a tonnage from 4 tons to under 10 tons. Type 4: Trucks with a tonnage of 10 tons to under 18 tons and 20-foot container trucks. Category 5: Trucks with a tonnage of 18 tons or more and cargo trucks with 40 feet containers.        Step 4 : Click Save Changes to save the edited information.  2. Toll fee calculation # You can see details here
3. Toll Station Report #  To view the Toll Station Report, see which stations have passed, do the following:  Choose  Reports >  Reports >  Toll fee.     3.1 Search #   You can search by the following criteria:  Date : Select available or optional time.  All: Total IMEI number entered. Normal: Total IMEI can send commands. Error: The total number of IMEI errors with a description of the error cannot be sent.

Device Group #   Management of equipment group - fleet for the purpose of managing and grouping general purpose devices into a group for easy management and monitoring. Ensure the safety for the operation process of people, vehicles, goods, …
  To view Manage equipment group - fleet do the following:
 Click on  Manage >  Configuration >  Device Group.     1. Create device group #   Step 1 : Click on Create device group    Step 2 : A dialog box appears as shown above:  Name : Set the device group name. Devices : Tick ‚Äã‚Äãselect devices that have something in common to group.      Step 3 : Click Add to complete the operation.  2. Search # Search by Device group name - fleet
 3. Edit #   Step 1: Click on  Edit.    Step 2 : The dialog box appears as shown above :  Name : Edit the device group name. Devices : Tick ‚Äã‚Äãselect devices that have something in common to group.      Step 3 : Click Save Changes to complete the operation.  4. Delete #   Click on  of the device group . Click OK if you agree to delete.

contents:
Driver #   Driver Management for the purpose of monitoring, checking and solving problems arising during vehicle operation. Control documents as well as the driver’s work to be able to handle - solve problems during operation.
  To view Driver Management do the following:
 Click on  Manage >  Configuration >  Driver.     1. Create driver #   Step 1: Click Create new driver    Step 2: The following dialog box appears:  Account : The account name you want to add a driver to. Name : The name of the driver installing the device. Phone number : Driver’s phone number. License number : Driving license class. Begin date : Driver’s license date. Expired date : Expiration date of driving license. Code : Driver’s license code. Email : Driver’s email. Address : Driver’s address. Description : Describe more necessary information,…      Step 3: Click Add to save the driver.  2. Search #   Step 1: Searchable by:  Name : Driver’s name. Code : Driver’s license number.
License number : Driving license class.      Step 2:  Press Search to view driving information. Click Reset to delete data, return to the original default mode.    3. Edit #   Step 1: Click on  Edit. Step 2: Edit the cells you want to edit. Step 3: Click Save Changes to complete the operation.  4. Delete #   Click on  of the device group. Click OK if you agree to delete.

contents:
Manage Geofences #   Manage Geofences to manage zones to check how many times a day the device goes in / out, and how long it is in there.
  To view Manage Geofences do the following:
 Click on  Manage >  Configuration >  Geofences.     1. Create new Geofences #   Step 1 : Click on Create new Geofences    Step 2: The Add Area dialog box appears as shown above:   to create polygon shaped area : Touch the screen to select the points that make up the area. At least 3 points.  Add points, edit each point according to the location you want to create an area.  To create a circular area, drag the map to select the area. Name : Enter the name of the area you want to create. Group : Select the zone group. Description : Describe what is special about that area,… Color, Opacity : Select the color and optional blur you want to display on the map.      Step 3: Click Add to complete the operation.  2. Search #   Search by region name.  3. Edit #   Step 1: Click on  Edit.    Step 2: A dialog box appears, edit the information you need to edit.    Step 3: Click Save Changes to complete the operation.  4. Change status #    Click on  >  Change status.
  Status will change from Activated  Not activated and vice versa.
  5. Delete #    Step 1: Click on  >  Delete.
  Step 2: Click OK if you agree to delete.

contents:
Manage notifications #  When the user wants to Archive Notification, the following 2 conditions must be met:  ON receive notifications. One of 3 options (App, Email, Telegram) is ON.    To view notifications, do one of the following:
 Way 1: Click on  Manage >  Alert - Schedule >  Notifications.    Way 2: Click on  Notification >  View all.   1. Search #   Step 1:  Date: Select the time you want to see the notification. Number plate: Select the device you want to see notifications on (default All devices).      Step 2:  Click Search to view notification details. Click Reset to reset to factory defaults.    2. Notification details # To view the notification details follow the following ways:
 Way 1: Click on  Details. The message dialog box appears:   Device name.  Notification time.  Message notification.  Notification address.  Location notification on the map.      Way 2: Click on  Notification >  Notice you want to see details. A message dialog box appears. Details like way 1 message dialog.   3. Notification settings # Way 1 #   Step 1: On the account tree, right click on the account you want to configure and select  Notification setting. Step 2: The configuration screen appears:  Tick on  Receive notifications if you want to receive notifications from the system.  Always active: Tick ‚Äã‚Äãto receive notifications 24/7. Activity in range: Set date to receive, time to receive notifications.   Email :Enter email in that box to add email (You can add 1 or more emails to send alerts about. To add reference email here). Telegram : Enter chat id to receive notifications on Telegram (You can add 1 or maximum 3 Telegram ids to send alerts about by clicking ).      Step 3: Tick on  to set on/off the Alert Types send alerts about Email, App, Telegram.    Step 4: Click Save to complete the operation.  Way 2 #   Step 1 : Click on  Notifications >  ƒëto set up notifications.    Step 2 - 3 - 4: Same as step 2 - 3 - 4 in Way 1  4. Mark read all # To mark a notification do the following:
 Way 1: Click on  to mark as unread and there will be  before the message type or  to mark as read. Or you can mark all as read by clicking  Mark read all.    Way 2: Click on  Notification > . Mark read/unread notifications. Or you can mark all as read by clicking  Mark read all.
title: 6.3.1 Notifications

contents:
Alert Rules # ‚ùó  When a rule is violated, an alert will be issued to the user.     To view the Alert Rules, do the following:  Click on  Manage >  Alert - Schedule >  Alert rules.     1. Create new #  Step 1: Click Create New.     Step 2:
  2.1 Alert type: Click on  Alert type. Select 1 from the list to create an alert. The right dialog box appears:
 Example: Exceeding the speed  Speed (km/h) : Enter the value to be alerted. If the vehicle’s speed exceeds 70 km/h, an alert will be sent. Is loop : Repeatable on/off is possible. If repeat on, will choose to repeat for how long / 1 time. Default is 5’/1 time in a certain period of time in which the warning is violated.        2.2 Notification: Click on  Notification
   Name : Enter an alert name. Text mess : Report the problem. Displayed when sending app/email alerts. Description : Purpose, desire when creating this warning,… Activate : Enable/disable alerts. SMS : Enter a phone number in that box to add a phone number. Email : Enter email in that box to add an email. You can add 1 or more emails to send alerts about. (Email list separated by ‘,’ or ‘;’). Tick ‚Äã‚Äãthe box  to set on/off Get notified via mobile app. Tick ‚Äãthe box  to set on/off Urgent notice . Weekly : Choose dates and times receive notifications as you wish. Date range  Always active. Activity in range : Choose a certain time period to receive that alert this week/this month,…   Time range : Select the time period you want to receive notifications.       2.3. Device: Click on  Device.
 Always select all devices : Enable/Disable applies selected alert to all devices / 1 device number in that account.      2.4 Geofence: Click on  Geofence.
 You can choose one of the following three options:  Ignore : Choose to receive all alerts. Both in and out of the area receive alerts. Out geofence:  Always select all geofence : On/Off applies the selected alert to all zones / 1 number of zones in that account.   In geofence:  Always select all geofence : On/Off applies the selected alert to all zones / 1 number of zones in that account.            Step 3 : Click Add to complete the operation.
  2. Search #    Step 1 : Search by the following criteria:
 Name : Enter 1 or more characters in the alert that you want to search for. Alert type : Select one of the alert types in that box to make it easier to search.    Step 2:
 Press Search. Press Reset : Reset to factory defaults.    3. Edit #   Step 1: Click on  Edit to fix the warning.     Step 2: Edit the information that needs to be changed.
  Step 3: Click Save Changes to complete the operation.
  4. Delete #   Step 1: Click on  >  Delete of the generated alert.    Step 2: Click OK to complete the operation.  5. Lock / Unlock alert #   In case you want to lock/unlock the alert, don’t want to use that warning anymore. In the process of moving, if there is a violation of that warning, it will not be notified again. If you don’t want to delete it, do the following:  Click on icon  >  Lock /  Unlock. Status will change  Activate /  Inactive.
title: 6.3.2 Alert Rules

contents:
Scheduled report #  Scheduled report is to schedule, select the time period to get data and send the report automatically.    Task Type: Schedule  Daily: The next day will automatically send the report. The data in the report file will be from yesterday. Weekly: Every Monday will automatically send the previous week’s report. Send to email: Send report to email.      Task type: Performed once  Will send report immediately after successful creation.    To view the report scheduling, follow the steps below:
 Click on  Manage >  Alert - Schedule >  Scheduled report.   1. Create new #   Step 1: Click on Create Scheduled report.    Step 2: A dialog box appears:  Name: Enter a report scheduler name. Type report: Select the report type that matches the purpose you want to receive the report for. Number plate: Select the device number plate to get the report data. Description: Enter a description of the report (If available). Push notification: Enable/disable to send app notifications. Status: Enable/disable to enable/disable this report operation. Quest Type:  Schedule : Choose to send reports to Daily / Weekly / both. Single task : Select the data collection period in the report. Send to email : Add email to automatically send the report as configured above and choose the file type to send to Excel/PDF.        Step 3 : Click More to generate the Scheduling report.  2. Search #   Step 1: Search by the following criteria:  Name : Enter 1 or more characters in the report scheduler name that you want to search. Number plate : Select 1 or more license plates you want to see the report.      Step 2:  Click Search to view scheduling. Clicking Reset will return to factory defaults.    3. Edit #   To edit report scheduling, do the following:  Step 1 : Click on  Edit schedule the generated report. Step 2 : Modify the name, report type, data retrieval time, … (if any changes). Step 3 : Click Save Changes to edit Report Scheduling.    4. Delete #   Step 1: CLick on icon  >  Delete of Schedule that report.    Step 2: If:  Select OK: Will delete scheduling that report. Select Cancel: Will cancel the delete operation.
title: 6.3.3 Schedule Report

contents:
Task Remind #  Task Remind is created to notify about app/web, automatically send email reminders to devices when needing maintenance or a related event,… Normally people forget, so the system will help you to remind when the warning level is reached.  To view reminders, follow these steps:
 Click on  Manage >  Alert - Schedule >  Remind.   1. Create new #    Step 1 : Click on Create Remind.
  Step 2 : A dialog box appears:
 Name: Enter the name of the reminder message. Number plate: Select a license plate you want to create a reminder for. Email: Enter email in that box to add an email. You can add 1 or more emails to send reminder notifications about. Description: Enter a more detailed description of the content,… Push notification: Tick ‚Äã‚Äãthe box to set to enable/disable Receive mobile app notifications. Auto repeat: Repeat reminder over time = number of days of previous notification. Activate: Enable/disable reminder mode. Activate:  Old maintenance: Select your advance maintenance date. Next maintenance: Select the next maintenance date that matches your appointment (required). Notify before end: Will take between the next Maintenance Date - Current Date.   Notify before end:  Old maintenance: When choosing a number plate, it will automatically show the distance traveled. Next maintenance: Enter your mileage maintenance appointment correctly. Notify before end : Will take between Next Maintenance - Previous Maintenance.   Remind by enigne hours:   To send this reminder to mail. Need to do one more step:
 Choose  Map >  Info > Extension > Engine input. Choose Engine input -> Ignition or Engine. Depending on which device is wired, then press Save Changes to complete the operation.      Old maintenance: When selecting the number plate, it will automatically show the running time of the engine.
  Next maintenance : Enter exactly with your appointment.
  Notify before end : Will take between Next Maintenance - Previous Maintenance.
        Step 3 : Click Add to create a reminder.  2. Search #   Step 1 : Search by the following criteria:  Name: Enter 1 or more characters in the reminder name that you want to search for. Number plate: Select 1 or more license plates to view assigned reminders.      Step 2:  Click Search to see a list of reminders. Clicking Reset will return to factory defaults.    3. Edit #   To edit a reminder, do the following:  Step 1 : Click on  Edit of that reminder. Step 2 : Edit information if there is any change about license plate, mail, reminder type,… Step 3 : Click Save Changes to save the edited information.    4. Delete #   Step 1 : CLick on icon  >  Delete of that reminder. Step 2: A dialog box appears:  Select OK: Will delete the reminder. Select Cancel: Will cancel the delete operation.
title: 6.3.4 Remind

contents:
Transaction History # To view point transaction history do the following:
 Click on  Manage >  Balance >  Transaction history.   1. Search #   Step 1: Search by the following criteria:  Date: Select the start and end time you want to see the transaction history. Ref: Fill in Ref code correctly or leave it blank to find all. Type: Select the type of transaction to view history. Pay: Select a payment status type. Tick on Sub account if you want to see on a child account.      Step 2:  Click Search to see a list of transaction history. Clicking Reset will return to factory defaults.    2. Edit #   Step 1: Click on  Edit    Step 2: A dialog box appears:  Source account: Select the account containing the objects to be transacted. Target account: Select the account that receives the transaction objects. Points: The number of points to pay for the transaction. Pay: Select payment status. Date pay: If you change the status Unpaid -> Paid, you need to select a payment date. Amount: Amount to be paid for the transaction. Photo of invoice: Upload invoice photo (If available). Note: Detailed notes for the transaction.      Step 3: Click Save Changes to complete the operation.  3. Details #   To view details of a Transaction history do the following:  Click on  >  Details. A dialog box appears Details transaction history.    4. Cancel transaction #   To Cancel transaction follow the steps below:  Step 1: Click on  >  Cancel transaction. Step 2:  Select OK: Will cancel the transaction. Select Cancel: Will cancel the delete operation.      5. Request cancel #   To Request Cancel follow the steps below:  Step 1: Click on  >  Request cancel. Step 2:  Select OK: Will cancel the transaction. Select Cancel: Will cancel the delete operation.
title: 6.4.2 Transaction History

SIM manage # -SIM Card Manager helps to manage all SIM card related issues with easy functions for managers. For details, please see items below.
 1.1 Add Sim #   Step 1: Click on Add Sim.    Step 2: A dialog box appears:   Account: Select the account to add a SIM.
  Download template: Download the sample file format.
  Select document: Upload CCID self-fill file.
  CCID: Enter your sim’s CCID.
  Click Check to check sim’s status
 Normal: Can add SIM. Error: Cannot add SIM with error description. Error CCIDs can be deleted by clicking on Remove CCID error.       SIM type: Select your SIM carrier.
  Description: Add detailed description.
      Step 3: Click Send to add a SIM.  1.2 Search #   Step 1: You can search by the following criteria:  Simno: SIM number (phone number), enter 1 or more characters to search. CCID: Serial number printed on SIM card, enter 1 or more characters to search. Status: SIM status. SIM type: Select the type of SIM to search. Service expire - Time from: SIM service limit. Service expire - Time to: SIM service limit.  SIM: From purchase to expiration is 15 months.   Created at: Select SIM creation date Sub account: Click on  if you want to search on the child account.      Step 2: Click Search to display the results or click Reset to reset to default.  1.3 Edit #   Step 1: Click on  Edit.    Step 2: A dialog box appears:  CCID: Can’t fix. Simno: Edit SIM phone number. SIM type: Select the SIM provider again. Description: Enter a description for the SIM.      Step 3: Click Save Changes to fix the SIM.  1.4 History #   To view the change history of the SIM do the following:  CLick v√†o  >  History. The change history dialog box of that SIM appears.    1.5 Delete #    Step 1: Click on  >  Delete.
  Step 2: Click OK if you agree to delete.
  1.6 Renewal #   Step 1: Click on Renewal:  Tick on  ch·ªçn 1 / Multiple / All SIMs.      Step 2: A dialog box appears:   CCID: Enter CCIDD or CCID auto-fill by ticking the SIM list in Step 1.
  Click Check to check sim’s status:
 Normal: Can add SIM. Error: Cannot add SIM with error description. Error CCIDs can be deleted by clicking on Remove CCID error.     Active date: Select SIM activation date.

      Step 3: Click Submit to renew your SIM.  1.7 Activate #  Activation will bring the SIM from the state Inactive -> Activated.
  To Activate SIM do the following:
 Step 1: Click on Activate:  Tick on  ch·ªçn 1 / Many / All SIM.   Step 2: A dialog box appears:   CCID:Enter CCIDD or CCID auto-fill by ticking the SIM list in Step 1.
  Click Check to check sim’s status:
 Normal: Can add SIM. Error: Cannot add SIM with error description. Error CCIDs can be deleted by clicking on Remove CCID error.     Service expire: Select the service term at the discretion of the SIM.
      Step 3: Click Send to activate the SIM.    1.8 Restore #  Refresh will return the SIM from all states to Inactivated.
  To Refresh SIM do the following:
 Step 1: Click Restore:  Tick on  ch·ªçn 1 / Many / All SIM.   Step 2: A dialog box appears:   CCID:Enter CCIDD or CCID auto-fill by ticking the SIM list in Step 1.
  Click Check to check sim’s status:

  Click Check to check sim’s status:
 Normal: Can add SIM. Error: Cannot add SIM with error description. Error CCIDs can be deleted by clicking on Remove CCID error.        Step 3: Click Send to lock the SIM.    1.10 Warranty #    To Send warranty SIM do the following:
 Step 1: Click on Warranty:  Tick on  ch·ªçn 1 / Many / All SIM.   Step 2: A dialog box appears:   CCID:Enter CCIDD or CCID auto-fill by ticking the SIM list in Step 1.
  Click Check to check sim’s status:
 Normal: Can add SIM. Error: Cannot add SIM with error description. Error CCIDs can be deleted by clicking on Remove CCID error.        Step 3: Click Send to send SIM warranty.    1.11 Change warranty expire #   Step 1: Click on Change warranty expire:   Tick on  ch·ªçn 1 / Many / All SIM.
  Step 2: A dialog box appears:

Toll Fee #   Toll Fee can be understood as finding the path from the starting point to the end point. How many toll booths will I go to where I go.
  Each station will have a different fee according to the type of vehicle.
  The displayed information may not be full of toll stations, only for reference for users to estimate the toll and choose the route of the vehicle.
  To estimate the fee, we do the following:
 Step 1: Click on  Utilities >  Toll fee calculation    Step 2: Enter information:  Transport type :Select the type of transport corresponding to the vehicle assigned to the locator. ( details click  on the right corner)  Avoid tolls: If Off will display the route with toll booths. If On will display the route will go around, passing the toll station with low price / no tollgate. Departure : Click the address on the Map will automatically fill in. Destination : Click the address on the Map will automatically fill in.
‚ùó  Note: Only when the Departure & Destination box is empty, the address will be automatically filled when clicking on the address on the Map.         Step 3: CLick  Esimated fee to search or click to  Reset to reset to default.    Step 4 : After displaying the results, the bus route will appear (section 4’. on the map) and a list of toll stations.    Clicking on each station in the information that has been counted will display that station on the map.

contents:
Installation and User Manual MDVR (SM400) # Step 1 : Hardware preparation #  SM400 Basic or Livestream recorder. Equipment conforms to QCVN31 S200 or S400 standards. Camera. 4G sim for SM400 livestream recorder (if available).
(No need for SM400 base recorder). 4G sim for QCVN31 standard equipment. Power cord connects standard equipment and recorder. And other accessories included: RFID card, SD card, GPS antenna, GSM (if any).    Prepare tools, tools:  TFT LCD HD Screen Integrated Car CCTV (7inch): For convenience when updating firmware/configuration or when handling errors. USB at least 1G : Save firmware and configuration files      Devices to install SM400 Basic as shown below:    Devices to install SM400 Livestream as shown below:   Step 2 : Wiring connection # Applies to both SM400 Basic and Livestream recorders.
 Plug the cord with a QCVN-compliant device connector to the SM400 recorder.    Plug the camera into the recorder in order from AV1 -> AV4. Insert SD memory card into SM400 recorder. Insert 4G sim (only for SM400 livestream) into SM400 recorder. Connect the SM400 recorder to the monitor for configuration. Power on the SM400 recorder.  Step 3 : Camera mounting position # ‚ùó  It is recommended to install the camera position according to ND10   Instructions for installing the camera ensure that the entire working process of the driver is observed. #  The position of installing the camera eye must ensure that the image is observed when the driver works, the image must ensure that the driver is visible from the waist up and the entire steering wheel controls the vehicle. The optimal camera installation position is in front of the driver, in a space that ensures an angle of Œ± ‚â§ 60 degrees (as shown in the figure below).  Depending on the type of camera eye, the mounting unit can be mounted above the driver’s head (between the steering wheel and the front of the vehicle).      The illustrations are as follows:    Observe the image of the driver working from the waist up and the steering wheel controlling the vehicle  Observe driver behavior such as answering the phone, not wearing a seat belt, etc.    Instructions for installing a camera to ensure that the passenger compartment is observed in the car #  The camera placement ensures a minimum view of the entire middle aisle space of the vehicle (1 or 2 middle aisles depending on the vehicle type). The optimal camera installation position is at the front of the vehicle as shown in the figure. Depending on the type of camera eye, the installation unit can be mounted on the roof of the vehicle at the front of the vehicle.    Illustrative images (1 aisle car, 2 middle aisle sleeper car) are as follows:   Instructions for installing a camera to ensure that the car’s up and down doors can be observed #   The location of the camera installation must ensure that the vehicle is closed and opened; ensure to see at least 50% of the car door image.
  Illustrative pictures (top 1-door car and 2-door car):
    Some pictures illustrating the position of installing a camera eye on some vehicles that can observe the working process of the driver, passenger compartment and car door as follows:   Step 4 : Recorder configuration #   (Only applicable for SM400 Livestream)
  GoTrack camera server IP settings
 171.244.003.120     Video settings: basic settings, main stream settings, sub stream settings, time settings, memory management, OSD settings
   Basic setting: basic recording parameter setting
  Video format: PAL, NTSC, press „ÄêOK„Äë key to choose from drop-down menu. Video mode: start-up video, timer video, alarm video, start-up recording: start recording automatically when device is on recording Timed recording: start recording within a timed recording interval and not recorded at other times. Alarm recording: the device starts recording when there is an alarm. Audio format: G726-M40K / G726-M32K / G726M40K / G726M32K / G711A. Sound gain: 0-14 levels optional, volume adjustment. Pre-alarm recording: record a period of time before the alarm. Alarm delay: the recording will continue after dismissing the alarm and the recording time is the set time. Alarm protection: In the video file list interface, select the video file to lock, it will not be automatically overwritten during alarm protection. Camera type: Select according to the camera’s resolution.       Main stream setting: setting recording parameters for each channel
  Channel name: preview and playback screen will be displayed. Main Recording: On: means the channel has the recording function on.
‚ùó  OFF: means the channel is not recording.    Resolution: 720P, D1, HD1 and CIF can be selected. For example, in PAL system: 720P resolution is 1280 * 720, D1 resolution is 704 * 576, HD1 resolution is 704 * 288, CIF is 352 * 288. Frame rate: indicates the number of video frames per second, PAL system is 1~25fps, NTSC system is 1~30fps. Image quality, image clarity, 1 ~ 8 levels, level 1 picture quality is the highest. Recording: On/off, indicates whether to record audio while recording video or not.       Sub stream setting: setting parameters of 4G network transmission video stream
  Sub video: on / off, whether to enable the video sub stream function or not. Resolution: CIF/HD1/D1 optional. Frame rate/image quality/recording: same as main stream setting interface parameters.       Time setting: set time recording interval
  You can set up to 4 recording intervals per day.You can set up to 4 recording intervals per day. Date: The specified period is valid for 7 days from Monday to Sunday. Time zone: the start time of the time zone cannot be greater than the end time.       Storage management:
  Purpose: Main video / secondary video option, select video stream. Priority: high/medium/low.       OSD setting: overlay information and display position of recorded video
  Stacked items: time / license plate / phone number / channel number / GPS information. Trigger: open/close. X/Y coordinates: the position where the information is displayed on the screen that overlaps.    Step 5 : Configure the camera on the platform #  You go to the page GPS GoTrack to login.     Step 1: Choose  Map >  Info of the device you want to add a camera to.
  Step 2: Select dialog box appears Camera:
 See details here    Step 6 : Configuration of receiving images #  Configure image reception according to SMS commands sent from S200/S400 . devices  Port rs232: rs232,0,9,115200# 300 seconds shooting frequency: rs232para,0,300,0# Server and image upload path:  server,file,photos.gotrack365.com,80# server,path,/api/receive-photos# reset#      Step 7 : Check photos, videos # 7.1. Check photos #  Details here  7.2. Check out the video #  Details here

contents:
Terms used # Point # 
Is the unit used for the activities of providing and maintaining software services on the GPS GoTrack platform.
Each account is given a wallet containing the number of Points it owns.
Device # ¬†¬†
Are hardware devices connected to the GoTrack platform for management, monitoring and tracking. These devices can be either a Black Box or a Camera.
Bike Service Package # 
Is a software service that provides management and monitoring features based on connecting a black box positioning device for motorcycles.
Car Service Package # 
Is a software service that provides management and monitoring features based on connection to a black box locator device for cars.
Combo basic service package # 
Is a software service that provides management and monitoring features based on connection with Camera, the recorder only takes pictures for cars.
 Total Camera > 2 => Update package Combo basic 4. Total Camera ‚â§ 2 => Update package Combo basic 2.  Combo plus service package # 
Is a software service that provides management and monitoring features based on connection to Camera, photo recorder and livesteeam for cars.
 Total Camera > 2 => Update package Combo plus 4. Total Camera ‚â§ 2 => Update package Combo plus 2.  Source account # 
It is an account containing transactional objects such as Points, Equipment
For example, when Selling / Transferring points, the source account is the account with points deducted for the number of points sold / transferred.
Target account # 
An account that receives transaction objects.
For example, when Selling/Transferring points, the target account is the account that receives the points corresponding to the number of points sold/transferred.
title: 11.1 Terms

Device Transaction # It is a transaction of adding new deivces to the Platform.
Currently there are 3 new types of additions as follows:
   Type Description     Yearly After selecting the Point package, it will be deducted immediately
The system automactically activate after 8 hours of continuos online device   Option Deduct points according to the total of months corresponding to the Package
The system activates immeditately after adding   Trial No points are deducted, the default package is Storage
The system allows online trial for 8 hours continuously    ‚ùó  Only an account with valid permissions can make this transaction.   The steps to add the new device are follows:
 Go to your Business page Select the Device tab Tap the Add device Enter the information on the form Press Submit to proceed  Renew Device # It is a renewing transaction corresponding to te Point Packakge which the device is working on
The steps to add the new device are follows:
 Go to your Business page Select the Device tab Enter IMEI / Device Name / Number Plate to search for Devices to be renewed Check the box to select Device to renew Tap the Renewal Press Submit to proceed  Change the Service Package # It is transaction to change the Point package of device
When changing, the number of transaction points will correspond to the new Package.
The steps are as follows:
 Go to your Business page Select the Device tab Enter IMEI / Device Name / Number Plate to search for Devices to be renewed Check the box to select Device to change the Point package Click Change Service and select the changing package Select the package to change on the form. Click Submit      Change the expiration service of device # It is a transaction that allows to change the expiration service of device
When changing, the points corresponds to the packakge and the time period is from the changing time to the new due dat
The steps are as follows:
 Go to your Business page Select the Device tab Enter IMEI / Device Name / Number Plate to search for Devices to be renewed Check the box to select Device to change the Point package Press the add button and select the service repair function Select the package to change on the form. Click Submit       ‚ùó  Only the authorized account can make this transaction.   Refresh device # Is a transaction that allows refreshing the device, ignoring all the current configurations of device. The transaction point corresponding to the package.
The steps are as follows:

contents:
Ticket #   Ticket can be understood as an event that needs exchange and support.
  Many times when customers ask for support through applications such as Zalo, Telegram… will drift messages, miss errors, and become uncontrollable, so customers need support when having problems/errors about software/devices. Support can be created on ticket.
  When creating a ticket on the system, the support staff will receive, process and respond to that ticket through the system.
  To Search/Create/Edit tickets, do the following:
 Click on  Back Office >  Ticket   1. Create new #    To create a ticket, do the following:
 Step 1: Click Create Ticket.    Step 2: Fill in the information according to the form that appears on the screen.  Department: Select the department that needs support. Title: Briefly enter the problem you need support. Phone number: Phone number to contact (If available). Email: Current email you are using (If any). Create for user: Click on the box to tick another account to create a household. If left blank, the default is created for the currently logged in account. Send to user: Enable to actively send to users. Off is to create a user. Content : Describe the problem in detail. Error on which device / screen, how it happened, at what time, … Attachments : Upload relevant data (If available).      Step 3: Click Add to create a ticket.    2. Search #   You can search by the following criteria:  Key | Title : Enter 1 / several words you want to search. Click on  / press Enter to search. Click on  to refresh data Click on  to filter by:  Status. Department. Account : Find the ticket that the account owns. Creator : Find the ticket that the account created for itself and create/add it for another account.      3. Status # 3.1 Open #   Successful ticket creation will display the default status of Open.  3.2 Answered #   When the Support team responds to the newly created ticket, the status will change from Open -> Answered.    To see the detailed answer on the support side, do the following:  1: Click on ticket for details. 2: Support’s response. 3: If you see that Support has responded back and you still have not checked / have questions / used notices as usual,… then enter the content, attachments (if any) ) and click resend feedback to support.    3.3 Processing #   When that ticket has responded but has not yet resolved the issue, the Support Department will leave the status as Processing.  3.4 Closed #   1: If Support has solved the problem, the response is complete, the user side has no more questions, can click Close ticket. Status from Replied -> Closed.    2: After closing the ticket, you can evaluate the quality of customer service by clicking on . 5 stars is the highest. You can only rate 1 time in 1 ticket.    3: When the ticket has been closed, but customers still have questions, they can continue to ask by replying.  Import content Attached File Click Send
Then it will change status as KH Responded and continue 1 round of such status.    4. Fast access #  Also can be quickly accessed in the following way:  Click on  Ticket & Notice > Ticket
title: 12.4.1 Ticket

Order - Device #  To manage Order-device do the following:  Click on  Back Office >  Order-device     1. Create new #   Step 1: Click on Add order-device    Step 2: A dialog box appears:  Order: Select the order you want to create. IMEI: Enter the IMEI to create for the order.   Click Check to check IMEI:
  All: The total IMEI number is entered. Normal: IMEI can be added. Error: Cannot add IMEI with error description. You can delete all faulty IMEIs by clicking on Remove devices error. OEM:    Description: Enter a description for the order.
  Status: Select the status of the order.
  Priority: Select the priority of the order.
  Classification: Select the order category.
        Step 3: Click Add to add an order - equipment.  2. Search #   Step 1: You can search by the following criteria:  Date: Select the time period to view the order. Account: Select the account you want to view orders. IMEI: Enter the device imei you want to view, enter one or more characters. Description: Enter the order return model you are looking for. Priority: Select priority (default selects all). Status: Select the status of the order (default selects all). Tags: Select the order category you want to find (default select all). Order: Enter the order code, enter one or more characters.      Step 2:  Click Search to view the Summary report by date. Press Reset to clear data and return to factory defaults.     3. Edit #   Step 1: Click on  Edit.    Step 2: A dialog box appears:  Description: Edit description. Status: Select status again. Priority: Reselect the priority. Tags: Select order category. Issue: Enter the problem in the order (if any). Cause: Enter the reason that the above problem occurred. Solve: Enter the solution for the above cause. Summary: Summarize the details of the problem. Cost: Order cost. Cost description: What is the cost to do, where to go,… Proccess by: Choose the account that handles the above problem.      Step 3: Click Save Changes to save it.  4. History #   Step 1: Click on  >  History.    Step 2: A dialog box appears with the order’s update history.  When the search results, click on  Download to export data:    5. Delete #   Step 1: Click on  >  Delete.    Step 2: A dialog box appears:  Click OK if you want to delete. Click Cancel to cancel the operation.

contents:
Privacy policy # This is a legal agreement between Customer and the Mobile App Nhu Quynh GPS for the service use. By using our service you agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of this agreement.
If Customer does not agree to this agreement, Customer may not use our service.
Overview # We are committed to ensuring that your privacy is protected. We will only use the information that we collect about you lawfully in accordance with The EU’s General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
All data that we collect is used solely for providing a service to you. In particular:
‚Ä¢ We do not sell, share or otherwise disclose your data to anyone;
‚Ä¢ We do not mine your data for patterns;
‚Ä¢ We do not use your data to target ads;
‚Ä¢ We do not access your location data without your permission.
Information that we collect # We collect the bare minimum of information required for GPS tracking:
‚Ä¢ Full name and address - used for billing and invoicing;
‚Ä¢ Username and password - used to authenticate users;
‚Ä¢ E-mail - used for notifying our users of changes in service and for resetting forgotten passwords;
‚Ä¢ GPS location data - sent by your GPS device or mobile device when you run our tracking software. We transmit the following data: your GPS coordinates, speed, altitude, angle, current time and various sensor parameters. We do not transmit your phone number, contact lists or any other data stored on your mobile device;
‚Ä¢ HTTP requests - as most web services, we maintain logs of all incoming HTTP requests. Web logs contain IP addresses, requested URLs, referral URLs, and other similar attributes provided by your browser.
Cookies # Cookies are small files that are temporarily stored by your web browser. They are used solely for session management (remembering who you are once you login) and for storing preferences. We use traffic log cookies to identify which pages are being used.This helps us analyze data about web page traffic and improve our website in order to tailor it to Customer needs. We only use this information for statistical analysis purposes.
Most of our cookies expire as soon as you log out or close the browser window.
We recommend that you enable cookie support in your browser as many features of our website will not work otherwise.
Security # Your data is stored on secure servers. We have taken further steps to prevent unauthorized access to your data, including running firewall software and keeping our servers up-to-date with security patches. That said, we cannot guarantee nondisclosure of personal information due to factors beyond our control. If you suspect that your account has been compromised, please contact us as soon as possible.
Connections are secured by Secure Sockets Layer (SSL). SSL is a standard security technology for establishing an encrypted link between a server and a client. SSL allows sensitive information such as credit card numbers, social security numbers, and login credentials to be transmitted securely. Normally, data sent between browsers and web servers is sent in plain text - leaving you vulnerable to eavesdropping. If an attacker is able to intercept all data being sent between a browser and a web server, they can see and use that information.
Account creation, login and recovery system was developed using latest authentication standards to prevent any hacking possibility.
During account creation, collected data is encrypted using one way encryption algorithm and being saved to database. One way encryption makes impossible to decrypt data. Data can be verified only using comparison method performed by genuine author.
Rights of access, correction and objection # You may request access to the personal data that is collected and to correct data that may be inaccurate. contents: Instructions for entering RFID card information # Step 1 - Prepare #  List of drivers with information: Full name, License 1 RFID read-write device, using S400 / S400E device that still works online RFID card, make sure the number of cards is enough compared to the number of Drivers.  Step 2 - Set up card information #  Turn on the RFID reader, make sure it’s online and in your account Place the card on the device Send the card setting command to the device according to the syntax  qcvn31rfidcard,write,<Ten_Lai_Xe>,<So_GPLX>#   After sending the confirmation command successfully, lift the card and reset it so that the device can receive the card’s content Go to Manage > Send command to execute orders. The device receives content when the Driver light is on, and there is content information on the monitoring web. Mark the successfully installed card with the Driver’s name. Start over for the next card.  Step 3 - Check the list of drivers #  With each successfully installed card, the system automatically saves driver information. Go to Manage > Configuration > Drive to confirm the successful installation information.
title: Update Card Rfid

How to connect Analog Fuel Sensor to FMB125 device. # Step 1 - Preparation # Ensure wiring Fuel Sensor to AIN1 signal of FMB125.
Ensure Power and SIM is normal.
Set IP, Port for the device sending to GoTrack Platform
Step 2 - Setup Analog Input # Check Analog 1 value is available on the Platform by creating a sensor.
If the value is not available, send GPRS command to enable Analog Input Parameter:
setparam 50180:1  then, send reset command to the device:
cpureset  Step 3 - Setup Sensor # Check again Analog 1 value is available.
Setup Tank information and Calibration values.
